com.github.nfcforandroid.api

Interface INfaWriter<Record extends INfaRecord>

  • Type Parameters:
    Record - the expected type to write
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractNdefWriter, AbstractWriter, AndroidApplicationWriter, EmptyWriter, ExternalNdefWriter, MimeTypeWriter, NdefWriter, SmartPosterWriter, TextExternalNdefWriter, TextWriter, UnknownWriter, UnsupportedWriter, UriExternalNdefWriter, UriWriter

    public interface INfaWriter<Record extends INfaRecord>
    Author:
    jefBinomed This interface is used when you want to write datas. You should implement this interface when you want to add a new way to write a special INfaRecord A set of implementations exists in the nfa-writers module

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getLength() 
      android.nfc.NdefMessage getNdefMessage() 
      android.nfc.NdefRecord getNdefRecord() 
      void init(Record record)
      Set the inner record with value in parameters
      boolean isInit() 
      void reset()
      reset the state of isInit() to have a result that produce false.

    • Method Detail

      • isInit

        boolean isInit()
        Returns:
        true if the data is in init state. This is use by the library to guaranty the non recalculation of getLength(). The best practice is to check if the inner record is null or not

      • reset

        void reset()
        reset the state of isInit() to have a result that produce false. You could set the inner record to null

      • init

        void init(Record record)
        Set the inner record with value in parameters
        Parameters:
        record - the record to set

      • getNdefMessage

        android.nfc.NdefMessage getNdefMessage()
        Returns:
        the convert Android NdefMessage corresponding to datas

      • getNdefRecord

        android.nfc.NdefRecord getNdefRecord()
        Returns:
        the convert Android NdefRecord corresponding to datas

      • getLength

        int getLength()
        Returns:
        the lenght in byte. -1 there is no record in it
